creator: varavamu@yahoo.com
text:
Here is a snippet:
<delete casesensitive="false" >
    <dirset dir="${apps.dir}" includes="**/obj" />
</delete>

The directory structure is: ${apps.dir}\Libraries\Core\obj\TempNs\abc.dll

The above snippet does not seem to select the directory represented by the
pattern. IS this a bug or is this how its supposed to work?

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
<delete> only deletes empty directories.  You want:

<delete includeemptydirs="true">
  <fileset dir="${apps.dir}" includes="**/obj/" />
</delete>

In the manual entry, this is what is meant by:

 the removal of empty directories can be triggered when using nested filesets by setting the 
includeEmptyDirs attribute to true. Note that this attribute is meaningless in the context of any of the 
various resource collection types that do include directories, but that no attempt will be made to delete 
non-empty directories in any case.
